meanings.definition: Nonsense or foolish talk or ideas.
meanings.sent1: Stop all that falderal and focus on the important things.
meanings.sent2: She dismissed his falderal and got straight to the point.
meanings.sent3: The meeting was filled with falderal, making it hard to take seriously.
meanings.sent4: His explanation was just a bunch of falderal that didn't make any sense.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's lecture was so full of falderal that the students couldn't follow along.

meanings.definition: Trivial or nonsensical fuss or ornamentation.
meanings.sent1: The party was full of unnecessary falderal like streamers and balloons.
meanings.sent2: She ignored all the falderal and focused on the real purpose of the event.
meanings.sent3: The elaborate falderal on the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was just a lot of falderal to distract from the real issues.
meanings.sent5: The fancy falderal on the dress made it stand out in the crowd.
